topics.body:
"@Virgil Stormblade":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559a992863687258be0041a8#post_559a992863687258be0041a8
I'm not particularly opposed. (My Hero Academia is also pretty good from what I've heard)

OPM is basically a Shonen about a Man who becomes so strong that fighting evil becomes boring to him. (Since It's completely effortless)

Also, He's just a normal dude who picked up being a Hero as a hobby.

And Everything else besides our hero is fairly typical shonen.

I guess so.

Anyway, It's kind of great how OPM doesn't look that out of place compared to most Shonen manga until Saitama shows up and instantly floors the bad guy with one blow.

There's also this thing in the remake, (The original was a web comic) where everything is drawn with an amazing amount of detail, (From the Eyeshield 21 artist) While our hero isn't drawn with nearly as much detail.

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559aa01763687239d3000a61#post_559aa01763687239d3000a61
He's a Vegeta alright. Y'know what's funny? In most Shonen, the Vegeta would usually be the better of the main character. But Vegeta himself is more or less equal to or less good than Goku. And got beaten up by him pretty bad. Whereas most Shonen would have the Vegeta beat the main character 5 seconds within fighting him at the beginning of the story.
